str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From dia and didomi; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. Deal out; also to deliver over.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A store-house for precious things; hence: a treasure, a store. From tithemi; a deposit, i.e. Wealth.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
And, even, also, namely.
Here; used also imperative hither!; and of time, hitherto.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
